messages.title: My Pledges to You
messages.content: I will be here all year round not just at election time. I will protect our armed forces and veterans. I will oppose any Tory police and public services cuts. I will oppose the closure of our local schools, hospitals and walk-ins. I will support foodbank users, the homeless and those struggling to heat their homes. I will support raising the minimum wage and banning zero hours contracts.

messages.title: A future fair for all
messages.content: When Labour came to power in 1997 there were just over 256,000 more people in the South West on the dole than today... Labour is also committed to change health care...

messages.title: 3 Questions for the Tories
messages.content: Why did the Tories sell off Citybus? Why did the Tories silence our MPs? Where is the Plymouth Prowler?

messages.title: Labour's in power
messages.content: Experts say Labour's time in power has seen a transformation of education with billions invested, crime has fallen with more police and crime down by a third, 8,000 more doctors and 14,000 more nurses and cleaner hospitals.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Opposing Tory police and public services cuts and ensuring the protection of schools, hospitals, and walk-ins.
Supporting foodbank users, the homeless, and those struggling with heating.
Raising the minimum wage and banning zero-hours contracts.

issues.education: Transformation of education with billions invested
issues.health: 8,000 more doctors and 14,000 more nurses and cleaner hospitals

leaflet.personalStatement: I'm proud that since 1997, we have more doctors and nurses and we've built most new schools than ever before.

quotes.text: "I'm proud that since 1997, we have more doctors and nurses and we've built most new schools than ever before."

images.caption: Luke Pollard in healthcare setting visiting patients.
